result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaime I Hernandez Jr

defendant.name: Hernandez, Jaime I, Jr
defendant.address: PO Box 900, Racine Correctional, Sturtevant, WI 53177-0900

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:39 AM Defendant Jaime I Hernandez Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brandon Carlson appears for Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Jaime I Hernandez Jr. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Case called for review hearing re: NGI report. 

Defense will accept NGI report opinion, and needs an offer from the State. Defendant formally withdraws NGI plea.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed. Signed by Judge Carter on 08/15/2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key of Case 21CF701.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A in 21CF701, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Court will enter a protective order. 
Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

Same appearances as Motion Hearing. 

Atty Wolff enters a not-guilty plea to counts #1 and #2, waives reading of complaint. 
State makes bail arguments and requests protective order. Defense makes bail arguments. 

Court will set cash bail of $3000.00 on 22CM945.Court will enter a protective order.

10:48 AM Defendant Jaime I Hernandez Jr appeared by video, in custody from RCI.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Jaime I Hernandez Jr.  Attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Case 22CM945 called for Motion to Dismiss and for initial appearance. 
21CF701 called for Review Hearing re: NGI evaluation. 

Defense makes arguments in support of Motion to Dismiss. 
State makes arguments in opposition of Motion to Dismiss. 
Defense makes further statements. 
For reasons stated on the record, the Court will deny the Motion to Dismiss. 

On 21CF701, NGI report was filed today. 
State and Defense has not had time to review the report before today's hearing. Court will set a review hearing in about a week.

Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Dismiss Count #2 From the Criminal Complaint, filed by Attorney Wolff.

Initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing on August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

02:11 PM Defendant Jaime I Hernandez in court by telephone means, in custody at Racine Correctional Institution, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  

The Court vacates the probable cause finding and bail as defendant requested to challenge probable cause after bail was set today.  
Attorney Wolff to file a motion to challenge probable cause within 10 days and the State to have 10 days after that to responde to the motion.
Court sets matter over for an adjourned initial appearance date along with a motion hearing on the next date before Judge Brad Schimel.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

The Court notes the defendant is currently in custody at Racine Correctional.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance and make arrangements for the defenant to appear by Zoom from Racine Correctional.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
